I guess it could be different in the states but here in Canada my midwife gave me a choice because I am very low risk of getting it. And she makes me pee on this stick that tests for surgar in your urine she said if I was to get it there will be surgar in my urine then I can go in and get tested if we feel I have it. As well the first test you do is NOT a gaurentee you have it, if you fail it doesn't mean you have gestational diabetes it means that there's a possibility and you will have to go for more testing. She gave us a hand out and told us to talk about it then we can decide to do it or not, my husband and I felt that I didn't need to do it so I didn't. I don't want any negative comments about our choice not to do it. My midwife told me if she feels I need to get it done she will tell me and she said I'm low risk and fine, if however, I spill sugar into my urine then she would recommend that I go in for the second test to be safe. It's You baby and body if you don't want to do it don't.
